communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax



Confidentiality: The information contained in this e-mail and any attachment(s) hereto is confidential and may be legally privileged. communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

MuckRock Staff

communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: Administrative Subpoenas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to research conducted by Wired, the Illinois Secretary of State received multiple administrative subpoenas from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the Department of Homeland Security between 2016 and 2022.

source: https://www.wired.com/story/ice-1509-custom-summons/

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of every administrative subpoena received by the agency from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.
- A copy of all email or mailed communications sent to or received from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security that pertain to the administrative subpoenas received between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: FOIA Response - MuckRock
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Requester –
Please allow this email to acknowledge your January 16, 2025, request (“Request”) pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (“FOIA”), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq., received on January 16 2025, seeking the following records from the Office of Illinois Secretary of State (“Office”):


  1.  A copy of every administrative subpoena received by [the Office] from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.
  2.  A copy of all email or mailed communications sent to or received from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security that pertains to administrative subpoenas received between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.

The Office has conducted a reasonably diligent search of its physical and electronic databases and has identified certain responsive records to your Request within its possession and custody.  Under FOIA, the Office may extend the time to respond to a Request by up to five (5) business days for a limited number of reasons.  5 ILCS 140/3(e).  The Office is extending the time to respond to your request by five (5) business days for the following reasons:  the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under 5 ILCS 140/7 or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions.  5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v).

The Office received your Request on January 16, 2025.  5 ILCS 140/3(d).  The Office was closed on January 20, 2025, bringing the original due date to January 24, 2025.  5 ILCS 140/3(d).  With the extension, the Office will respond to your request on January 31, 2025.

Respectfully,

[A close-up of a coin  Description automatically generated with medium confidence]
FOIA OFFICER
Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias
115 S. LaSalle St., Suite 300
Chicago, IL 60603
Office:  312.814.1630
Email:  FOIARequest@ilsos.gov<mailto:FOIARequest@ilsos.gov>
Hours:  Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.

communications.subject: RE: FOIA Response - MuckRock
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Requester –

Please allow this email to acknowledge your January 16, 2025, request (“Request”) pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (“FOIA”), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq., received on January 16, 2025.  On January 23, 2025, the Office properly extended the time to respond to your request by five (5) business days to January 31, 2025.  Your Request seeks the following records:


  1.  A copy of every administrative subpoena received by [the Office] from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.
  2.  A copy of all email or mailed communications sent to or received from Immigration and Customs Enforcement and/or the Department of Homeland Security that pertains to administrative subpoenas received between 1/1/2016 and 12/31/2022.

The Office has conducted a reasonably diligent search of its physical and electronic databases and has identified certain responsive records to your Request within its possession and custody.  The responsive record is attached with this correspondence.  However, the Office has redacted certain exempt information contained within the responsive records pursuant to applicable FOIA exemptions.  The Office’s factual basis for this partial denial of your request is detailed below.

The Office has redacted unique identifiers, including social security numbers; driver’s license numbers; and signatures (Ill. Att’y Gen. Pub. Acc. Op. No. 14-015, issued March 25, 2014, at 11) from the responsive record pursuant to FOIA exemption 7(1)(b), which expressly exempts private information from disclosure.  5 ILCS 140/2(c-5); 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b).

The disclosure of the following information is a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and therefore the Office is withholding the following information: date of birth (IIl. Att’y Gen. Pub. Acc. Op. No. 16-0098, issued November 7, 2016, at 12); other third-party names, for instance, the names of suspected who were never arrested and of other persons referenced incidentally in reports, such as relatives or neighbors (Ill. Att’y Gen. PAC Req. Rev. Ltr. 31526, issued November 26, 2014, at 6).  5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c).

Note:  You have the right to have any denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (“PAC”) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General.  5 ILCS 140/9.5(a).  You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to:  Public Access Counselor, Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd St., Springfield, IL 62701, (877) 299-3642, public.access@ilag.gov<mailto:public.access@ilag.gov>.  5 ILCS 140/9.5(a).  You also have the right to seek judicial review by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court.  5 ILCS 140/11.

Respectfully,

[A close-up of a coin  Description automatically generated with medium confidence]
FOIA OFFICER
Secretary of State Alexi Giannoulias
115 S. LaSalle St., Suite 300
Chicago, IL 60603
Office:  312.814.1630
Email:  FOIARequest@ilsos.gov<mailto:FOIARequest@ilsos.gov>
Hours:  Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Park Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Park Service)
communications.communication:
Dear National Park Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to National Park Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Parole Commissioner and Hearing Examiner Employee Salaries

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Parole Commissioner and Hearing Examiner Employee Salaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent annual salaries for the following employees within the Maryland Parole Commission: 

Commissioners: Lisa A. Vronch, Robyn E. Lyles, John Dale Smack III, Denise Smith, Ernest Eley, Jr., Anthony J. McAllister, David Blumberg
Hearing Examiners: Mya Collins, Sharon Garrett, Chelsea Hicks, Sam Kelley, Charles Neverdon, Julie Nicholson, Kim Redditt, Ronald Williams, Tyler Wright, Gina Clay

Please provide each individual person's salary, not the total budget line item for commissioners and hearing examiners (sometimes referred to as "hearing officers").

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Wourms

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Wallace MBTA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All written or electronic communications, including email attachments, sent or received by Assistant Secretary Robert Wallace  that refer in any way to the Migratory Bird Treaty Act, including any communications send or received by Mr. Wallace that contain one or more of the following words or phrases: "Migratory Bird Treaty Act" and/or "MBTA". This request seeks records produced since June 1, 2019. This request does not seek generic news articles or aggregations of news articles. 

I am a reporter with The Guardian and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Student Assignment: 2024, First Semester, Transfer Data

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Student Assignment: 2024, First Semester, Transfer Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Anonymized data of all school transfers of CPS students from the start of the 2024/2025 school year to December 31, 2024. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the original school, the receiving school, and the month and year of transfer.

Include the transfer code in the above-requested data table:

1. 33 - Transfer Outside of Chicago
2. 86 - Unable to Locate
3. 31 - Transfer within CPS
4. 32- Transfer to non-public
5. 52 - Program Ended, PreK or K
6. 40 - Homeschooled
7. 35 - Legally Committed to an Institution
8. 87 - 17 or >, Cons to Wthd

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Welcome to the FOIA Center!
communications.communication:
Thank you for registering with the CPS FOIA Center. Please log in to the FOIA Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Your Login ID is:  178892-56794246@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. (https://cps.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx?) 
 
 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fstudent-assignment-2024-first-semester-transfer-data-178892%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tTWVQ%3AN05_KOmAcldyiu046n-JUCZXp8TK1Lzf8xQEj1amraE 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016646-010225
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
01/31/2025 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016646-010225 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

1. Anonymized data of all school transfers of CPS students from the start of the 2024/2025 school year to December 31, 2024. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the original school, the receiving school, and the month and year of transfer. 

Include the transfer code in the above-requested data table: 

1. 33 - Transfer Outside of Chicago 
2. 86 - Unable to Locate 
3. 31 - Transfer within CPS 
4. 32- Transfer to non-public 
5. 52 - Program Ended, PreK or K 
6. 40 - Homeschooled 
7. 35 - Legally Committed to an Institution 
8. 87 - 17 or >, Cons to Wthd 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fstudent-assignment-2024-first-semester-transfer-data-178892%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tTWVQ%3AN05_KOmAcldyiu046n-JUCZXp8TK1Lzf8xQEj1amraE 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests. Please log in with your username and password to access the records 

Please be advised that school-level notifications of death (code 41) have been redacted in order to shield impacted student families and communities from an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c). You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Furniture purchases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records and communications about purchases of furniture for the Charlotte and William Bloomberg Medford Public Library, including communications with vendors.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jim Kang

title: Agency predictive model documentation (New York State Department of Labor)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Agency predictive model documentation (New York State Department of Labor)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Executive summaries, algorithmic impact reports, predictive model reports, and/or model validation studies dating from Jan. 1, 2017 until the present for all predictive analytics tools and automated decision systems (ADS) used by the agency. This includes predictive models and ADSs built in-house as well as those built by vendors for the agency or those used by agency employees through third-party software.

2) All contracts and statements of work regarding the purchase and/or creation of tools identified in response to part one of this request.

2) A data dictionary/library for each predictive model and ADS identified in response to part one of this request. Please note: Data dictionaries list the names of data fields (i.e. column headers in a spreadsheet), they do not contain the actual data analyzed by models.

If you have any questions regarding this request, please don't hesitate to contact me for further clarification.

I ask that all fees be waived as I am a journalist and intend to use the requested records to publish articles in the public interest. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: Henry "Hank" Lyle Adams FOIA request (Denver Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Henry "Hank" Lyle Adams FOIA request (Denver Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails and all communications pertaining to Native American rights activist Henry "Hank" Lyle Adams, an obituary of whom was published in Indian Country Today on December 31, 2020 with the title "Obituary: Henry 'Hank' Lyle Adams." A copy of this obituary is attached to this email as a PDF, and it may also be found at https://indiancountrytoday.com/obituaries/obituary-henry-hank-lyle-adams?redir=

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Henry "Hank" Lyle Adams in other documents, to be included with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Estes

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Risk insurance information (rochester police department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Insurance premiums and coverages for risk/tort insurance; policy numbers, coverage limits, premimiums.  what insurance agency it's through and what part of it is self insured and what part is not self insured by the municipality or county.   Torts tort coverage amounts per incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

john Doe

communications.subject: Police Department Records Request :: P005760-013025
communications.communication:
Dear john Doe: 
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records from the Rochester Police Department/Olmsted County Sheriff's Office. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Minn. Stat. Chapter 13, Government Data Practices Act. Your request was received in this office on 1/30/2025 and given the reference number  P005760-013025 for tracking purposes. Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation.  If your request has been submitted after normal business hours, on the weekend, or on a holiday, the date received is the next business day. NOTE: Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Insurance premiums and coverages for risk/tort insurance; policy numbers, coverage limits, premimiums. what insurance agency it's through and what part of it is self insured and what part is not self insured by the municipality or county. Torts tort coverage amounts per incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

john Doe

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Frochester-police-department-9616%252Frisk-insurance-information-rochester-police-department-178650%252F%253Femail%253DTHelgeson%252540rochestermn.gov&url_auth_token=AABPQf9GeT9GRgFFwPwnjnBp1ns%3A1tdOVz%3AgSBE_oxvspPllXzy5VhaWuPpJjhMBoK8K9ssqDMw8qQ 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Government Data Practices Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Rochester Police Department/Olmsted County Sheriff's Office

Insurance premiums and coverages for risk/tort insurance; policy numbers, coverage limits, premimiums. what insurance agency it's through and what part of it is self insured and what part is not self insured by the municipality or county. Torts tort coverage amounts per incident.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

john Doe

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (U.S. Department of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

communications.subject: Status Update for Request #F-2025-06600 with U.S. Department of State
communications.communication:
Dear DAVID MEDEIROS, 

The status of your FOIA request #F-2025-06600 has been updated to the following status 'Received'. To learn more, you may log into the DoS FOIA Portal via the Application URL at https://pal.foia.state.gov. 
If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Please check your email account (including junk/spam mail) for the Department's response OR allow 7 to 10 business days to receive the Department's response by US Postal Service mail.
Regards, 
U.S. Department of State

This acknowledges you information access request to the U.S. Department of State.  Your request number is F-2025-06600. You will find additional information such as the date your request was received and your request status in your electronic portal page under this case number. 

If you requested expedited processing, a fee waiver, or if unusual circumstances apply, you will receive additional correspondence from us. 
For further assistance or to discuss any aspect of your request, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIA Public Liaison via email to FOIAStatus@state.gov or by telephone at (202) 261-8484. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov)

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2025-06600
communications.communication:
*** I demand the full name, title, and contact information of the individual(s) responsible for this communication. The repeated lack of identifying information and failure to meet accommodations violates federal laws, including FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552) and ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132). If these issues are not addressed within five (5) business days, I will escalate the matter to appropriate oversight bodies.

Follow-Up Demand Regarding FOIA Communication Compliance

To: Office of Information Access Liaison
U.S. Department of State
Subject: Identification of Responsible Individual(s) for FOIA Response – Request #F-2025-06600
From: David Medeiros
Date: December 27, 2024

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to formally demand the immediate disclosure of the full name, title, and contact information of the individual(s) responsible for the recent communications regarding my FOIA request, F-2025-06600.

This omission of identifying information and the continued failure to provide it violate:

Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552): FOIA requires transparency, including the accountability of officials responding to public records requests.
Americans with Disabilities Act (42 U.S.C. § 12132): The lack of identification and clarity in communication imposes additional barriers, in violation of ADA provisions ensuring equal access.

Adherence to ADA Accommodations
I remind you of my explicit accommodation requests due to my brain injury, including:

Direct MUCKROCK PLATFORM Communication Only: All updates and records must be sent directly to my designated MUCKROCK Platform. External portals or platforms requiring login credentials are inaccessible to me and must not be used.
Accessible Formats: Any records or documents provided must be in screen-reader-compatible PDF formats, with plain-text summaries where necessary.
Confirmation of Compliance
Please confirm in writing that all future correspondence will adhere strictly to the accommodations outlined above.

The lack of identifying information in your correspondence is deeply concerning and contradicts the standards of accountability and transparency outlined in FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552). Furthermore, failure to address my accommodation requests creates barriers to my access rights and violates federal disability rights laws.

If I do not receive a full response, including the identification of the responsible individual(s) and confirmation of compliance with ADA requirements, within five (5) business days (by January 3, 2025), I will have no choice but to escalate this matter. Such escalation will include filing formal complaints with the following entities:

U.S. Department of Justice Civil Rights Division (ADA enforcement)
Office of Government Information Services (FOIA oversight)
Relevant congressional oversight committees
The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)

Specific Demands
Within five (5) business days, I require:

Full name and title of the individual(s) responsible for prior responses regarding FOIA #F-2025-06600.
Direct contact information, including email and telephone number, for future communications.
Escalation Notice
Failure to provide this information by January 3, 2025, will result in:

Formal complaints to the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) for FOIA violations.
ADA compliance escalation to the U.S. Department of Justice, Civil Rights Division.
Notification to Congressional oversight committees responsible for FOIA and ADA compliance.
I trust that your office will take immediate corrective action to address this issue and fulfill the obligations of transparency and accessibility under federal law.

Thank you for your prompt attention.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

*** Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
Subject: Urgent Request for Investigation into OSC Case Records, Altered Decisions, and Suppressed Reports

Dear FBI Team,

I am formally requesting your assistance to investigate systemic failures, misconduct, and potential criminal activity surrounding the handling of my submissions to the Office of Special Counsel (OSC). These failures directly impact whistleblower protections, Medicaid oversight, and public accountability.

Issues to Investigate

1. Case Numbers and Records Management

Case Numbers Requiring Investigation:

DI-25-000310

DI-25-000325

DI-25-000379

DI-12192024714

DI-12112024134

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11252024342

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11272024158

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11282024737

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12022024333

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12032024933

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12042024718

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12052024838

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12062024939

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12072024240

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12112024134

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12202024300

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-112620241121

2. Anonymity and Lack of Accountability in Decision-Making

Unsigned Determination Letters:
Many determination letters from OSC lack identifiable signatures, names, or clear authorship.
This practice raises serious concerns about accountability and compliance with transparency laws.

3. Suppressed or Altered Records

Evidence suggests discrepancies between the whistleblower reports I submitted and how they were recorded or handled by OSC.
Specific issues include:
Alterations or removal of content from submitted complaints.
Suppression of reports that exposed systemic failures in Medicaid oversight and retaliation against whistleblowers.

4. Lack of FOIA Compliance
Despite repeated Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, OSC and related agencies have failed to provide:
Complete case files and communication logs.
Justification for withheld or redacted information.

Clear timelines for compliance.

Specific Questions to Investigate

1. Who is Responsible for Managing These Records?
Identify the individuals, teams, or automated systems involved in creating, altering, and assigning these case numbers and reports.

2. What Decisions Were Made and Why?
Determine how decisions were reached, why some reports were closed without action, and why letters were sent anonymously.

3. Were There Violations of Federal Law?
Investigate potential obstruction of justice, retaliation, or misuse of authority under whistleblower protection laws and FOIA.

Key Agencies and Officials Involved

This matter spans multiple federal and state agencies, including:
• Office of Special Counsel (OSC)
• Department of Justice (DOJ)
• Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS)
• Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
• Office of Inspector General (OIG)

Why This Matters

1. Whistleblower Protections:
Retaliation against whistleblowers and suppression of reports undermine federal protections designed to safeguard transparency and accountability.

2. Impact on Vulnerable Populations:
These failures harm Medicaid consumers, particularly those with disabilities, by allowing systemic mismanagement to persist unchecked.

3. Misuse of Taxpayer Funds:
Lack of oversight and accountability results in waste and misuse of federal funds meant to serve the public.

Requested Actions

1. Investigate Record Management:
Audit all OSC records, emails, and internal communications related to these case numbers.
Identify responsible individuals or systems.

2. Subpoena Additional Evidence:
Secure all suppressed or altered reports to ensure a complete and accurate investigation.

3. Hold Accountable Those Involved in Misconduct:
Recommend prosecution or disciplinary action for any individuals found to have violated federal laws.

4. Ensure Compliance with FOIA and Whistleblower Protections:
Mandate OSC and related agencies to comply fully with FOIA requests and whistleblower laws.

Attachments

I have attached all available documentation, including:
Correspondence with OSC, including determination letters and emails.
FOIA requests and responses (or lack thereof).
Detailed reports submitted to OSC and other federal agencies.

This issue demands immediate attention to uphold the principles of transparency, accountability, and justice. I am available to provide additional information or documentation as needed.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

___________________________

Subject: 12/23/2024 Freedom of Information Act Request: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

To all It May Concern in All Relevant Departments and Divisions,
Federal Bureau of Investigation

Michael G. Seidel
Section Chief

Information Management Division
This correspondence pertains to my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. Your handling of this matter raises critical concerns under FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552), the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA, 42 U.S.C. § 12132), and constitutional principles of government accountability.

OSC Case Records

Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11252024342 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11272024158 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-11282024737 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12022024333 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12032024933 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-12042024718 .pdf

OSCFiling-MedeirosDavid-DI-112620241121 .pdf

OSC File No. DI-25-000379

DI-25-000310

DI-25-000325

DI-25-000379

DI-12192024714

DI-12112024134

As recognized in National Archives and Records Administration v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004), transparency is fundamental to democracy and public trust. Your agency’s obligations are not discretionary, and failure to meet them constitutes a violation of statutory and constitutional law. This letter establishes your duties, addresses deficiencies, and anticipates and counters all potential deflection strategies.

1. FOIA Obligations: Statutory Mandates and Required Actions
FOIA establishes an enforceable right of access to federal agency records. Your response must meet the following requirements:

A. Timeliness
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A), you are required to provide a determination within 20 business days. Delays beyond this timeframe, absent legitimate extension requests, constitute a violation of FOIA.
Countermeasure: Delays are actionable under Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington v. DOJ, 711 F.3d 180 (D.C. Cir. 2013).
Required Action: Provide the requested records or a lawful determination.

B. Adequacy of Search
FOIA requires a thorough and reasonable search for records, as established in Campbell v. DOJ, 164 F.3d 20 (D.C. Cir. 1998). This includes:
Identifying the databases, locations, and terms used.
Providing a sworn affidavit detailing the search scope.
Countermeasure: A vague claim of "no responsive records" is insufficient without a detailed affidavit.
Required Action: Submit a sworn affidavit documenting the search or confirm the existence of responsive records.

C. Proper Use of Exemptions
Exemptions under 5 U.S.C. § 552(b) must be narrowly applied and justified with specific explanations. Blanket or vague exemptions are impermissible.
Countermeasure: A Vaughn index (Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973)) is required to justify each withholding.
Required Action: Submit a Vaughn index detailing each exemption and its justification within 10 business days.

D. Decentralization and Referrals
Referrals or decentralization excuses do not absolve your agency of its responsibility to provide a consolidated response. As held in McGehee v. CIA, 697 F.2d 1095 (D.C. Cir. 1983), agencies must coordinate internally to ensure compliance.
Countermeasure: Require assurance of continuity and coordination across divisions.
Required Action: Consolidate records from all relevant offices and provide a unified response.

2. ADA and Rehabilitation Act Compliance: Equal Access as a Legal Right
As a person with a documented disability, I am entitled to reasonable accommodations under the ADA and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act. Your failure to provide accessible formats for requested records constitutes discrimination and violates federal law.

Case Law:
Tennessee v. Lane, 541 U.S. 509 (2004): Agencies must ensure meaningful access to government services.
Alexander v. Choate, 469 U.S. 287 (1985): Denial of reasonable accommodations creates barriers that violate civil rights.

Required Action:
Provide all requested records in accessible formats, including plain-language summaries or electronic files compatible with assistive technologies.
Confirm compliance with ADA requirements by [specific date].

3. Mandated Reporting and Whistleblower Protections
Your handling of this request implicates broader concerns, including potential fraud, misuse of federal funds, or retaliation against whistleblowers. Under the Whistleblower Protection Act (5 U.S.C. § 2302), you are required to report and address systemic violations.
Countermeasure: Reference Misprision of Felony (18 U.S.C. § 4), which requires the reporting of observed violations of law.
Required Action: Document and escalate evidence of misconduct to oversight bodies, including the Office of Inspector General (OIG).

4. Consequences of Non-Compliance
Failure to comply with your statutory obligations knowingly constitutes violations of:
Obstruction of Justice (18 U.S.C. § 1505): Delaying lawful access to records obstructs public accountability.
Civil Rights Violations (42 U.S.C. § 1983): Denying ADA accommodations constitutes a deprivation of federally protected rights.
Misprision of Felony (18 U.S.C. § 4): Concealing or failing to report observed violations is a criminal act.
Countermeasure: Prepare for judicial review, oversight complaints, and public advocacy if compliance fails.

5. Escalation Pathways
If your office does not comply within the specified timeframe, I will escalate this matter through:
Judicial Review: Filing a lawsuit under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(B) to compel disclosure.
Oversight Complaints: Submitting formal complaints to OGIS, OIG, and the DOJ Civil Rights Division.
Public Advocacy: Engaging investigative journalists, transparency advocates, and public interest organizations to ensure accountability.

6. Final Statement: Upholding Transparency and Accountability
This matter reflects the public’s right to transparency and the preservation of trust in government institutions. Your actions will either affirm your agency’s commitment to accountability or further evidence systemic disregard for these principles.

I look forward to your prompt and substantive response.

David Medeiros
ABI Resources

Title: Co-Chair, Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)

Phone: (202) 456-1414

Summary of Responsibilities

Each individual and organization listed plays a crucial role in federal and state oversight, advocacy, and the protection of civil rights. Their functions include but are not limited to:

Oversight & Accountability: Ensuring compliance with federal and state laws, including Medicaid regulations, FOIA, ADA, and civil rights protections.

Transparency & Advocacy: Promoting open government practices and supporting whistleblower activities.

Civil Rights Enforcement: Addressing violations of constitutional and statutory protections against discrimination.

Legislative Oversight: Monitoring government programs and expenditures, particularly those impacting vulnerable populations like Medicaid beneficiaries.

Judicial and Administrative Review: Offering remedies for non-compliance through litigation or administrative actions.

ADA Accommodations Request

This request includes explicit ADA accommodations to address cognitive processing challenges resulting from my traumatic brain injury (TBI). These accommodations are legally required under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132)

and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Requested ADA Accommodations

To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I request the following accommodations for all communications and records:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats

All documents must be provided in properly labeled PDFs or plain-text files.

Ensure that the documents are screen-reader compatible and retain clear, accessible formatting.

Exclusive MuckRock Platform Communication

All communications must occur exclusively via the MuckRock platform.

Do not send external links, emails, portals, passwords, codes, or require phone calls for access.

Text Embedded in Email Bodies

Key information must be embedded directly in the email body to facilitate comprehension and accessibility.

Simplified Summaries

Provide plain-language summaries for complex or legal documents to ensure clarity and understanding.

Identification of Responsible Officers

Include the full name, title, and contact information of all responsible officers handling this request.

Non-Negotiable Compliance

These accommodations are non-negotiable and are essential for ensuring equal access to information. Failure to provide the requested accommodations may constitute a violation of the ADA and the Rehabilitation Act. Thank
you for ensuring compliance and accessibility in addressing this request.

Dear Mr. Medeiros:

This is in further response to your December 26, 2024, Freedom of Information Act
request, received by the Civil Rights Division, seeking access to records pertaining to:

1. OSC Case Records Complete files, internal and external communications,
investigations, and resolutions regarding: DI-25-000310; DI-25-000325; DI-25-
000379; DI-12192024714; DI-12112024134.

2. Interagency Correspondence Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS,
HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding: Whistleblower disclosures and
investigations. Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional
compliance. Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural
violations.

3. FBI Involvement Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related
investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid; compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower
allegations. Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records
related to: ADA compliance investigations. Complaints and procedural
documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844. Federal and state
enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits All internal and external audits, investigations, and
compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI)
Waiver Program. Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of
funds, and oversight deficiencies.
Freedom of Information/PA Unit –4CON
950 Pennsylvania Ave., NW
Washington, DC 20530

6. FOIA Compliance Records Metadata, processing logs, and communications
related to this FOIA request, including: Identified responsible officers and internal

procedural reviews.

After a thorough search, I have determined that the Civil Rights Division has no records
pertaining your request.

If you are not satisfied with the Civil Rights Division’s determination in response to this
request, you may administratively appeal by writing to the Director, Office of Information Policy
(OIP), United States Department of Justice, 441 G Street, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, D.C.
20530, or you may submit an appeal through OIP's FOIA STAR portal by creating an account on
the following website: https://www.justice.gov/oip/submit-and-track-request-or-appeal. Your
appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within 90 days of the date of my
response to your request. If you submit your appeal by mail, both the letter and the envelope
should be clearly marked "Freedom of Information Act Appeal."
Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at
the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services
they offer. The contact information for OGIS is: Office of Government Information Services,
National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park,
Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-
684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. Please reference the FOIA/PA No. above in any
correspondence with OGIS.
I hope the Civil Rights Division has been of some assistance to you in this matter.

Sincerely,

April N. Freeman
April Freeman, FOIA Liaison
Freedom of Information/Privacy Acts Unit
Civil Rights Division

Via Email: requests@muckrock.com Re: Freedom of Information Act and/or Privacy Act Request #FOIA-2025-060 Dear Mr. MEDEIROS: Please be advised that your Freedom of Information Act(FOIA) and/or Privacy Act request to the U.S. Office of Special Counsel (OSC)has been in the request queue pending processing. We acknowledge your request and are committed to communicating with requesters. After an initial review when it was received, your request was placed in our “Simple” track for FOIA requests. (OSC categorizes its FOIA requests in three tracks, “simple,” “complex,” and “expedited.” We then generally process the requests in the order in which they were received within each category). Because your request is Simple and it has been a long time since you made the request, OSC would like to confirm that you are still seeking the records requested. If you find that you no longer need the requested records,please advise BY REPLY EMAIL stating that you longer wish to have your request processed. We will administratively close your request at that time. If you remain interested in the records, please advise BY REPLY EMAIL stating that you wish to have your request processed. You may wish to consider narrowing the scope of your request, which will allow us to provide a response more quickly. If you wish to speak with someone directly, you may contact the FOIA Public Liaison, at 202-804-7000. If we do not receive a response to this message within 30 working days, we will administratively close your request. Thank you for your attention to this matter. We look forward to hearing from you soon! Thank you,
Office of the Clerk U.S. Office of Special Counsel 1730 M. St, NW Washington, DC 20036 foiarequest@osc.gov Attachment

Please note that although the Medicaid program is jointly funded by the federal government and the states, each individual state is responsible for administering the operations of their Medicaid program. CMS is not in possession of Medicaid claims records, and therefore we are unable to provide these state records. Therefore, after a careful search of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) files, i.e., a search reasonably calculated to locate records responsive to your request and employing reasonable standards, we were unable to locate any records responsive to your request.If you view our response as an adverse determination, you may appeal. The challenges we face today demand more than acknowledgment—they require action, collaboration, and a unified commitment to solutions. Together, we must embrace transparency, accountability, and compassion as the
foundation of our efforts. By fostering open communication, prioritizing the needs of the most vulnerable, and holding systems accountable, we can rebuild trust and ensure equitable outcomes for all.

Solutions lie in unity—when state and federal leaders, advocates, and communities work hand in hand to uphold justice and fairness. Transparency through accessible Freedom of Information processes, adherence to legal
mandates, and robust oversight are the pillars that support meaningful change. Each of us has a role to play in creating a system that serves and protects.

Our collective mission is clear: to build bridges between agencies and communities, ensure the dignity of every individual, and honor the principles that guide us toward progress. Together, with determination and unity, we can
overcome systemic failures and pave the way for a brighter, more inclusive future.

Americans living with disabilities and their families are Americans—full citizens of this nation, protected by the same Constitution that guarantees the rights and freedoms of every individual. We are not separate, lesser, or forgotten. We are Americans with the same unalienable rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

We stand firmly on the principles of equality, dignity, and justice. Our voices matter. Our contributions matter. And our rights—our Constitutional rights—must be respected, upheld, and protected without exception or delay.

We are Americans with rights. Period.

David Medeiros

https://www.archives.gov/founding-docs

communications.subject: Status Update for Request #F-2025-06600 with U.S. Department of State
communications.communication:
Dear DAVID MEDEIROS, 

The status of your FOIA request #F-2025-06600 has been updated to the following status 'In Process'. To learn more, you may log into the DoS FOIA Portal via the Application URL at https://pal.foia.state.gov. 
If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Please check your email account (including junk/spam mail) for the Department's response OR allow 7 to 10 business days to receive the Department's response by US Postal Service mail.
Regards, 
U.S. Department of State

communications.subject: Ref: F-2025-06600, Freedom of Information Act Response
communications.communication:
**THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL** 
Dear Mr. DAVID MEDEIROS 
This is a response to your December 27, 2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) request received by the U.S. Department of State, Information Access Programs on December 27, 2024. Your request:  " Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325,DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS,and Medicaid Oversight Records"(Date Range for Record Search: From 1/1/2013 To 12/27/2024). 
Please note that you contacted the U.S. Department of State with the United States federal government.  The U.S. Department of State's records document (1) the formulation and execution of U.S. foreign policy and (2) the administration and operations of the U.S. Department of State and its missions abroad.  For information on the U.S. Department of State's records visit, https://foia.state.gov/. 
Based on the original request you provided; we do not have reason to believe the U.S. Department of State has records responsive to your request.  Accordingly, we are administratively closing the request. 
Furthermore, we suggest that you contact the OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS and HHS directly for records related to this request. You can find their contact information by going to FOIA.gov - Freedom of Information Act ( https://www.foia.gov/ ).  
This recommendation is based on our knowledge of the requested records and should not serve as confirmation that these agencies are in possession of those records. 
If you are not satisfied with this response, you may administratively appeal by writing to: Appeals Officer, Office of Information Programs and Services (A/GIS/IPS), Room B-266, U.S. Department of State, 2201 C Street, NW, Washington, D.C. 20520; by fax to (202) 485-1718; or by email to FOIAAppeals@state.gov . Your appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within 90 days of the date of this email.  Please include a copy of this correspondence with your written appeal and clearly state why you disagree with the determinations set forth in this response. 
If you have any questions regarding your request, please contact our FOIA Requester Servi ce Center or our FOIA Public Liaison by email at FOIAstatus@state.gov or telephone at 202-261-8484.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, email at ogis@nara.gov ; telephone at 202-741-5770; or toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Sincerely, 
K.B. for, Brooke Nicholas Supervisory Government Information Specialist Office of Information Access Liaison Information Access Programs 
U.S. Department of State 
**THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL**

I am formally requesting your assistance to investigate systemic failures, misconduct, and potential criminal activity surrounding the handling of my submissions to the Office of Special Counsel (OSC). 2. Anonymity and Lack of Accountability in Decision-Making

Unsigned Determination Letters:
Many determination letters from OSC lack identifiable signatures, names, or clear authorship.
This practice raises serious concerns about accountability and compliance with transparency laws.

3. Suppressed or Altered Records

Evidence suggests discrepancies between the whistleblower reports I submitted and how they were recorded or handled by OSC.
Specific issues include:
Alterations or removal of content from submitted complaints.
Suppression of reports that exposed systemic failures in Medicaid oversight and retaliation against whistleblowers.

4. Lack of FOIA Compliance
Despite repeated Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, OSC and related agencies have failed to provide:
Complete case files and communication logs.
Justification for withheld or redacted information.

Clear timelines for compliance.

Specific Questions to Investigate

1. Who is Responsible for Managing These Records?
Identify the individuals, teams, or automated systems involved in creating, altering, and assigning these case numbers and reports.

2. What Decisions Were Made and Why?
Determine how decisions were reached, why some reports were closed without action, and why letters were sent anonymously.

3. Were There Violations of Federal Law?
Investigate potential obstruction of justice, retaliation, or misuse of authority under whistleblower protection laws and FOIA.

Key Agencies and Officials Involved

This matter spans multiple federal and state agencies, including:
• Office of Special Counsel (OSC)
• Department of Justice (DOJ)
• Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS)
• Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
• Office of Inspector General (OIG)

Why This Matters

1. Whistleblower Protections:
Retaliation against whistleblowers and suppression of reports undermine federal protections designed to safeguard transparency and accountability.

2. Impact on Vulnerable Populations:
These failures harm Medicaid consumers, particularly those with disabilities, by allowing systemic mismanagement to persist unchecked.

3. Misuse of Taxpayer Funds:
Lack of oversight and accountability results in waste and misuse of federal funds meant to serve the public.

Requested Actions

1. Investigate Record Management:
Audit all OSC records, emails, and internal communications related to these case numbers.
Identify responsible individuals or systems.

2. Subpoena Additional Evidence:
Secure all suppressed or altered reports to ensure a complete and accurate investigation.

3. Hold Accountable Those Involved in Misconduct:
Recommend prosecution or disciplinary action for any individuals found to have violated federal laws.

4. Ensure Compliance with FOIA and Whistleblower Protections:
Mandate OSC and related agencies to comply fully with FOIA requests and whistleblower laws.

Attachments

I have attached all available documentation, including:
Correspondence with OSC, including determination letters and emails.
FOIA requests and responses (or lack thereof).
Detailed reports submitted to OSC and other federal agencies.

This issue demands immediate attention to uphold the principles of transparency, accountability, and justice. I am available to provide additional information or documentation as needed.
